e4: Adopting the new policy ensures accurate and transparent financial reporting, aligning with ethical standards and reducing legal risks. It improves investor trust by eliminating bias, thus providing a fairer assessment of the company's performance. Although some investors might initially misinterpret the change, clear communication can mitigate misunderstandings over time, benefiting all stakeholders.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and consistency, ensuring all stakeholders have access to truthful and timely information. It avoids biases or manipulations that could mislead or disadvantage any group of investors. Such a policy upholds corporate responsibility, complies with regulatory standards, and considers the broader impact on market fairness and investor trust.
e6: What steps does management plan to take to effectively communicate the policy change to all investors? How will potential misunderstandings from smaller, less informed investors be addressed? Additionally, what measures will ensure smooth transition and maintain investor confidence during this change?
